line_1: Rogues may grow fat, an Honest man dares starve.
line_2: With such vile instruments their fortunes carve;

line_1: For I have Food while others starve,
line_2: Not more than others I deserve,

line_1: Of him, whose hungry friends they leave to starve,
line_2: Anxious each paltry relique to preserve

line_1: As if you'd in the midst of Plenty starve,
line_2: Whilst even there, you praise with such Reserve,

line_1: As if you'd in the midst of Plenty starve,
line_2: Tho' ne'er so liberally we Authors carve.

line_1: To love the Arts, nor let the Artists starve;
line_2: Rewards for Worth, with lib'ral hand to carve,

line_1: Some while they're Sots, and other while they Starve.
line_2: Him dully they Adore, him blindly Serve,
